comment.text: Plays a key role in glycolysis.
Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; pyruvate from D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate: step 5/5.

disease.name: Pyruvate kinase hyperactivity
disease.description: Autosomal dominant phenotype characterized by increase of red blood cell ATP.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Pyruvate kinase deficiency of red cells
disease.description: A frequent cause of hereditary non-spherocytic hemolytic anemia. Clinically, pyruvate kinase-deficient patients suffer from a highly variable degree of chronic hemolysis, ranging from severe neonatal jaundice and fatal anemia at birth, severe transfusion-dependent chronic hemolysis, moderate hemolysis with exacerbation during infection, to a fully compensated hemolysis without apparent anemia.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

There are 4 isozymes of pyruvate kinase in mammals: L, R, M1 and M2. L type is major isozyme in the liver, R is found in red cells, M1 is the main form in muscle, heart and brain, and M2 is found in early fetal tissues.
Belongs to the pyruvate kinase family.

property.value: Hemolytic anemia due to red cell pyruvate kinase deficiency
Regulation of gene expression in beta cells

feature.description: In PKRD; loss of catalytical activity; dbSNP:rs773626254.
In PKRD; Tjaereborg; unstability of the protein and decrease in catalytic activity.
In PKRD; Tokyo/Beirut; most common mutation in Japanese population; no conformational change; dbSNP:rs74315362.
In PKRD; Mantova; almost complete inactivation; dbSNP:rs147034239.
In PKRD; Amish; no conformational change; dbSNP:rs118204085.
In PKRD; frequent mutation; no conformational change; dbSNP:rs116100695.
In PKRD; instability of the protein; dbSNP:rs185753709.
In PKRD; the most common mutation in European population; dbSNP:rs113403872.
In PKRD; Complete loss in the responsiveness to fructose 1,6-bisphosphate, FBP; dbSNP:rs201255024.
